data.text: @KariLakeFox10 In America maybe.. the rest of the world will buy more and more Nike products now.
@KariLakeFox10 You racist wypipo seem to think that everybody is pissed at Nike. Wrong! And the colleges won’t do shit. They’re under contract! #ColinKaepernick #CKRocks #Nike
@Deo_et_patriae @KariLakeFox10 Don't bet on it, mueller will indict him before that
@KariLakeFox10 Nike's customers are overwhelmingly young.  They're buying the stock BECAUSE of the ad.  They'll buy the products either way.
@KariLakeFox10 They shouldn’t!  Kaepernick stood for something he believed in... we all should be so bold!!  Proud of him and Nike for beliving in what he kneels for... #believeinsomething!!
@Deo_et_patriae @KariLakeFox10 Like Trump has angered 70% of the country?
@iamjhco @KariLakeFox10 They’re
@KariLakeFox10 I refuse to watch @nfl or buy @nike but , Nike is getting exactly what they wanted.. everyone is talking Nike...
@KariLakeFox10 Football is no longer a sport. Its all politics& big money. Me& mine will never go to another game in person or spend a dime at NFL!!!
@KariLakeFox10 All the men & women of the armed forces believe in “ something “ too Nike

@KariLakeFox10 @realDonaldTrump @NPR There are tons of ways to fight issues like hiring attorneys etc not standing for our National Anthem is not one of them. Respect our Country and the people that fought for our freedom.
@KariLakeFox10 There it is https://t.co/5cWGIqRVp4
@KariLakeFox10 Sorry: CEO (fat finger syndrome)

@KariLakeFox10 You have many people with no business or investment expertise weighing in here. This will be one of the smartest marketing moves ever by Nike. You should follow Ed Freeman from UVA  to understand more. But as a CRO For 30 years and a VC this is a BRILLIANT move.
@Ten7Mike @KariLakeFox10 100% wrong. Doing what’s right is ALWAYS profitable in the long term

@KariLakeFox10 @wildkat8_kat @Nike Because business is about elevating our collective humanity, not only focusing myopically on profit. And understanding that drives profit more than anything. Doing what’s right is VERY profitable. Pay attention to what happens to Nike next. They will be the winners of this debate
@KariLakeFox10 Hope so!!!!!
@KariLakeFox10 Colleges will keep nike because they're about dollars, not education.
@KariLakeFox10 Fuck that pussy bitch kaepernick and nike too
@KariLakeFox10 @wildkat8_kat @Nike The answer to your Q is literally spelled out for you...
@PhxRd @KariLakeFox10 Change is good. Society changes.. and Marketing must change with it.
@fox10PhotoChief Me too.

@ibphotokari @KariLakeFox10 Thanks for your reply. Thank you for sharing your point of view. It helps for me to understand things from a marketing point of view. It certainly is true that everyone is talking about it. Things have certainly changed through the years. Protection of brand used to be Paramount

@PhxRd @KariLakeFox10 Well, first off, He’s controversial so people who agree/disagree are going to take even more notice, bringing more attention to the Brand. Even if it’s at times negative attention, it’s still attention.
@KariLakeFox10 Somewhere in there, there's is money to be made.
@KariLakeFox10 Nike will go down in history as one of the greatest brands ever. They know there on the right side of history!
@ibphotokari @KariLakeFox10 Not slamming you, but I  am curious why you think this is genius? And how this helps Nike?

@OkazuYuri @KariLakeFox10 @BillNigh With total respect to you, I think because everyone is outraged or offended about something,  and politics is everywhere,  people want an escape from it all. 
But when you upset a large portion of the population,  it really is bad for your products image. That being the NFL

@KariLakeFox10 Didn't they also inject their thoughts on Serena Williams skin tight tennis suit?
I see a new 'edgy' trend.
@KariLakeFox10 Kapernick Over Our Police?!  Nah👎
@fox10PhotoChief @KariLakeFox10 Love this

@KariLakeFox10 @BillNigh There is nothing risky about this. He's a man who protested police brutality peacefully and was blacklisted for it. The same thing other civil rights leaders experienced.  We can do better, but this is pretty insincere of you

@KariLakeFox10 We are less than culturally competent if we believe this man's form of protest means something risky to an organization. I can think of another example of protest that was much more disruptive than this man's in ancient Rome by commoners. https://t.co/4aS3l1qasP

@KariLakeFox10 I’m a marketing professional and I think it’s genius. Keep in mind, Mohammed Ali was brutally criticized for his public protests. Those who boycott Nike for this cant see the forest for the trees.
@KariLakeFox10 Brand suicide.
@KariLakeFox10 I would love to hear the answer.
@patmiletich @KariLakeFox10 Lol

@KariLakeFox10 I'm a financial analyst but from my general biz knowledge I can tell you that @Nike will very likely pull out within the next day or two, citing "negative feedback" or some other BS. Then will say "it was not our intention to offend". Sadly, that may work if done soon enough.
@CraigNArizona Spot on!.. You are more of a business professional than the heads of Nike!
@Darryl_Evanoff @KariLakeFox10 Only a trump and dump involves America's stock climbing to levels you can't afford.
@patmiletich @KariLakeFox10 Better than a Trump 'n Dump. 🤣
@KariLakeFox10 Great way to tank the stock for friends to come in and buy it up. It's called "smash and grab"

@KariLakeFox10 It’s a great message generally. However the delivery of his message is patronizing and misguided and actually, even per WAPO statistics, not factual. Just based on that, I have no idea why they would risk their biz for this guy. But they will see. They all do.
@KariLakeFox10 All I know is, I'm not spending 200:$ on shoes that fall apart in three months just to do it again.fuck Nike and thier crap product.
@KariLakeFox10 #NIKEFAIL
@KariLakeFox10 Nike lost me. If crapernick would like a change get off his knees and go to the places he is making this stand for and work on it there
@KariLakeFox10 @Nike I also want to say that I love the message and it is what we should ALL be teaching to our children!

@KariLakeFox10 @Nike I cannot answer that question entirely, but they clearly know what they are doing. They are making a statement. If they have made a mistake, I’m sure people will still buy their shoes and products & they surely won’t go bankrupt.
@wildkat8_kat @Nike Of course he does. My question is why would Nike wade into this? And risk alienating a lot of customers.
@KariLakeFox10 He has every right to speak his truth & stand up for what he believes in. It’s called Freedom of Speech! Nike apparently gets it! @Nike
